creditline: The Ellen and Fred Wells Fund
description: round-bodied jar with a small foot; dome lid and dome finial; one applied spiral coil handle; decorated with repeating stamped design
text: During the Unified Silla Dynasty (668-935), the exaggerated ceramic shapes of the earlier Silla and Kaya kingdoms' ceramics gave way to more compact and contained forms. Potters produced a wide variety of tableware, ranging from completely unadorned pieces to cups, jars and bottles elaborately decorated with stamped designs.
title: Jar
